body:
Hi @connortann 
I tried to reproduce the error, but it works fine in my case. The value did not change on pressing enter and then scrolling. I tried with few other cases as well. 

However, the value did change when the cursor was placed inside the widget and I tried to scroll but I believe that is working as designed. Scrolling with cursor inside the widget should increase or decrease the value based on our scrolling action.

Hi @anzarwani ,
Thank you for taking a look at reproducing the issue. You're right, the issue only occurs if the cursor is over a widget when the scrolling starts. I'll update the description above to add this detail.

I would argue this really shouldn't be the default behaviour, as it becomes really problematic for apps that have a large number of numeric input parameters. In a real-life app I'm working on there is a column of a few dozen numeric inputs, so users naturally click into the window and scroll up and down to enter values. In that setting there is a high probability that the cursor happens to be over a widget, and users have reported the accidental modification as a bug.

Here's a screencast which illustrates this a bit more clearly: it's hard to use the page without accidentally modifying a widget.

```python
import streamlit as st
st.title("Demo of scrolling issue")
for i in range(20):
    st.number_input("Enter a number", value=0.0, key=f"number_{i}")
```

[demo2.webm](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/assets/71127464/66347150-a845-4dad-a7b5-410eb4b8eeff)

Could there be an option to disable this behaviour?

@connortann 
I am not sure if this should come as an enhancement, but as a workaround you can disable scrolling in input widget using javascript code.
That would be helpful. Do you have any guidance on how that can be done?

This is a big request on our end.  We have a page where four critical numbers are entered.  We don't think we've been burned by this, but we have had users mention they've had it happen and then fixed it.  We would never enable the scroll-edit feature by default. (FWIW, we also see this when you scroll pages with multiple plots, and the plot has to scroll wheel zoom without alt or shift).  I would love to be able to disable scroll-editing via a flag in the setup so I can guarantee this never happens.  I'd also be OK with being able to disable +/- buttons.  Entering a 3-digit number with +/- isn't a thing.

I'd be interested in taking a look at this. Currently thinking of adding another argument to st.number_input that would toggle this behavior.

Interestingly, this bug seems to be browser dependent. I can reproduce it fine using Edge, but Firefox does not seem to have this issue.
@kmcgrady Are you currently working on this? I've been reading the codebase for the past few days and think I have an idea.

issue.title: [WIP] Fix Scrolling with mouse wheel unintentionally modifies st.number_input values

repository.name: streamlit

## Describe your changes
Hi all, I'm a new contributor working on this issue. Could anyone point me to how/where the st.numer_input widget is rendered in the .tsx files?
## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)
https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/8867
## Testing Plan

- Unit Tests (JS and/or Python)
- E2E Tests
- Any manual testing needed?

body: Hey @jiangpli. I have something that seems to work, but I didn't get it PR ready (tests and whatnot). Happy to let you try it out and help out!
@kmcgrady Sounds good, how can I help?
